Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the mistake most make is to not understand that each 640 blocks is a SINGLE data sample

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it should be 60 seconds, dont believe that page about 1min 2 seconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so 640 blocks is one cycle, one data point

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you need many data points to get a statistically valid sample

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: half the blocks in the 640, maybe you dont get any notarizations, so it is very easy to have a small time sample and conclude you are not getting any notarizations. you change a bunch of things and start getting notarizations, then conclude what you changed must have fixed it, when it more likely was that you became eligible again in the 640 blocks cycle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and this happens for each coin mostly independently

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and you need to be cross connected to all the peers in the bestmask

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and a ping time less than a second

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: run a test for say 2 weeks, change one variable and see the result

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not saying there are not things you can do to improve things, but the most effective is to be running all the time with utxo on a good hardware with good connectivity
